alert.note: Alert for Coal (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 11 at 11:16PM CDT until May 12 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1145 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN COAL COUNTY... At 1116 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 6 miles south of Gerty, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Weather spotters reported a funnel cloud. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Coal County. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a storm shelter, safe room, or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
